thread.title: Hamilton in London: Fans share their joy as they snap up tickets for the West End production
thread.title_full: Hamilton in London: Fans share their joy as they snap up tickets for the West End production

author: Jessie Thompson
title: Hamilton in London: Fans share their joy as they snap up tickets for the West End production
text: End of the £300,000 London home is in sight, experts warn Fans who were successfully able to nab tickets for the West End production of Hamilton have been expressing their jubilation on Twitter. Those who wanted to make sure that they could be in the room where it happens had to endure a tense wait in an online queue, before buying tickets for performances over a year away. Fortunately, they’re willing to wait for it. The hip hop American history musical written by Lin-Manuel Miranda, and much-loved by Barack Obama , is coming to the Victoria Palace Theatre in November. It premiered on Broadway in 2015 and has already won a Pulitzer Prize, a Grammy Award and eleven Tony Awards. Miranda tweeted to British fans that the time was nigh to book their tickets. — Lin-Manuel Miranda (@Lin_Manuel) January 16, 2017 Some weren’t organised enough and threw away their shot. When you didn't sign up for #Hamilton tickets five years ago so might as well give up on life now... pic.twitter.com/KV3Yj5ZB4g — Zoe Sharp (@zoelissima) January 16, 2017 Everyone got Hamilton tickets from the looks of things. I FORGOT. — Olly Gibbs (@ollyog) January 16, 2017 Oh God. I'm out on the high street and I forgot about Hamilton tickets. Those who got their hands on tickets were left feeling pretty satisfied. Just got presale tickets for Hamilton. Now gotta wait 367 days to see it. — Hannah White (@hannahvwhite) January 16, 2017 Tickets for Hamilton bought. Play it cool, Matt. Play it cool. #HamiltonLDN pic.twitter.com/rpwhpCGtT2 — Matthew Sandman (@msandman) January 16, 2017 I JUST GOT TICKETS FOR HAMILTON AND IM CRYING BECAUSE THIS IS POSSIBLY THE BEST DAY OF MY LIFE
